messages.title: Real support for our local NHS staff and services
messages.content: The NHS is underfunded and understaffed – with far too many people on waiting lists and NHS staff stuck with an unfair pay cap. Gareth will demand more funding, to relaunch Brentwood Community Hospital and for more GP surgeries where people live – not just in the town centre.

messages.title: Fighting school cuts and improving education opportunities
messages.content: Unless things change secondary schools will have lost up to £900,000 a year and primaries up to £115,000 by 2020. Gareth will fight these cuts and add more support for schools. He will back teachers and support staff to help deliver the education our children deserve.

messages.title: Taking on the social care crisis and delivering for our older generations
messages.content: Social care in Essex and across the country is in crisis with around one in every 20 care roles vacant. Gareth will demand action on links to hospitals and increased funds for unpaid carers. He will push for real action from local authorities to support our residents in need.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Gareth will demand a good school for every child and proper funding for our schools. He will help deliver more teachers and support for staff.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Defending the health and social care services we need
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Gareth will take real action to help tackle the crisis in social care and demand increased funding for our health services.
Gareth will help oppose Tory cuts for local police and back Labour’s funded plan for 10,000 more police on our streets.
Gareth will work to tackle bad and costly parking, introduce real action on litter, and support real housing investment to help people locally.

issues.economy: The Tory economy is letting families down.
issues.education: Gareth will fight school cuts and improve education opportunities.
issues.health: The NHS is underfunded and understaffed.
issues.socialWelfare: Gareth will take on the social care crisis and deliver for older generations.

community.content: Gareth will work to tackle bad and costly parking, introduce real action on litter, and support real housing investment to help people locally.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have grown up in Brentwood attending St. Peter’s Primary School and Hedley Walter High School before heading for university. I became councillor for Brentwood South in 2014 and am currently the Labour Group Leader in Brentwood. I am determined to give back to the town – was a governor at my old school, by setting up Sawyers Hall College. I currently work with a tenants association and am completing a PhD in public policy part-time at Birkbeck, University of London. The Brentwood and Ongar community, my community, really matters to me. It’s where I have spent my entire life and been a great place to grow up. I am determined to be an MP who backs our schools with real investment, works to make local services better, and pushes government for help to fix the issues that matter to you.

contactInformation.address: 69 Heseltine Houses, Warley Mount, Brentwood, CM14 5EJ

endorsements.endorsement: As grandparents, our main concern is for the kind of Britain our children and grandchildren will inherit. We want it to be a society with good schools for all its children, health care for all, enough housing, decent jobs and a clean environment in which people feel they belong. We believe Gareth supports just such a Britain and, coming from the younger generation, his commitment gives us hope for the future.

quotes.text: Brentwood and Ongar is my home. It’s where I grew up, went to school and it’s where I chose to buy my first home. I am proud to be Labour’s candidate for June’s general election and will not stop fighting for our community.

images.caption: Gareth and his team are determined to stand up for all the people of Brentwood and Ongar.
